title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-11.6 - Pump or feeding device
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-11.6 - Pump or feeding device

State Regulations

Every miniature boiler shall be provided with at least
one feed pump or other feeding device, except where it is connected to a water
main carrying sufficient pressure to feed the boiler or where the steam
generator is operated with no extraction of steam (closed system). In the
latter case, and on electric miniature boilers with an input of 9 kw or less, in lieu of a feeding device, a suitable connection or opening shall be provided
to fill the generator when cold. Such connection shall be not less than
one-half inch pipe size. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
14-11.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
